page.title: 18S/N Entertainment
page.content: Scotton pantomine has become a new tradition in recent years, and the 3 performances play to a packed and appreciative audience in the village hall. It is very much a village enter- tainment being written and produced by husband and wife Tom and Coreen Brown, who like the rest of the Drama Group live in Scotton.The group has also put on plays by Priestley and Rattigan.The WI Drama Group usually gives an annual production, the 1985 one written and produced by 2 WI members. Scotton has benefitted from the Lincolnshire & Humberside Arts subsidised tours for professional companies with visits from Hull Truck, Durham Theatre and Webb-Foote companies.This year L & HA introduced a scheme for tours by young professional musicians: recitals for guitar in April, flute and harp in November - all in the Village Hall.
